"Our board, with the assistance of independent advisors, determined that this transaction, upon closing, will deliver immediate, significant and certain cash value to our stockholders," Graham Weston, co-founder of Rackspace, said in the release.
Rackspace shareholders should receive $32 per share in cash and the total transaction of $4.3 billion includes "the assumption" of $43 million of net cash.
Rackspace RAX, -11.42% a managed cloud company, is being taken private by Apollo Global Management in a $4.3 billion acquisition, the company said Friday.
The Rackspace board of directors unanimously approved the agreement and recommend stockholders vote in favor of it.
Shares have gained 23% in the past three months, compared to the S&P 500's SPX, -2.33% gain of 4%.
The Wall Street Journal reported on August 3 that the companies were close to a deal.
The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2016.
Rackspace shares were up 4% pre-market trade Friday.
